wikipedia_page.main:
Alderman Stephen William Moutray (born 25 February 1959) is a Democratic Unionist Party (DUP) politician in Northern Ireland. He was a Member of the Legislative Assembly (MLA) for Upper Bann from 2003 to 2016. He was also a councillor on Craigavon Borough Council, where he served as Mayor from 2010 to 2011.
Moutray was elected to Craigavon Borough Council in 2001 as a DUP councillor. He is member of all the major committees and is vice-chairman of Environmental Health Committee.

List of members of the 4th Northern Ireland Assembly

response: Documenting the influence of the Foundation within Northern Ireland unionist politics, and particularly the DUP, the Belfast Telegraph noted in 2012 that politicians close to it included Northern Ireland health minister Edwin Poots, Minister for Social Development Nelson McCausland, junior minister Jonathan Bell, Diane Dodds MEP, Gregory Campbell MP, David Simpson MP, Paul Givan MLA, Stephen Moutray MLA (and mayor of Craigavon), Jim Allister, leader of Traditional Unionist Voice, and TUV press officer and East Antrim parliamentary candidate Sammy Morrison. A leading Belfast Telegraph journalist wrote on another occasion that "Caleb plays a role within the DUP analogous to the old Militant tendency within the Labour party". Also in 2012, the Irish Daily Star noted that Caleb "claims a support base of 200,000 evangelicals" and asked whether it had "overtaken the Orange Order as the most influential pressure group within Unionism".
She worked full-time in the Lurgan DUP Advice Centre under Stephen Moutray, whilst working as a councillor. Lockhart was elected as an MLA for Upper Bann in 2016.
